intro: Leptoderris micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered banyan, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and has a buttressed trunk typical of many tropical species.
